This did not help and she was having loss of visual acuity and started not being able to speak properly so went to the ED for concern over Strokes. had 2 MRIs, and determined not to be having a stroke so was released to home. Sxs seemed to resolve ( like a spell) . Was still having bowel issues and she also developed a rash from the neck to the groin. So she went to a specialist. The Rash cleared after about 3 days. Specialist advised that the sxs were all due to the COVID Vaccine. Flank pain under the right ribs has also been present, this is not improving, it is a dull pain that seems to be worsening ( the bowel seems to be about back to normal now) She is planning on speaking with her PCP about the right flank pain.
81 2021-04-28 muscle tightness She got the vaccine, and had no reactions at all other than perhaps a chill. About 2-3 weeks later... Read more
Close
She got the vaccine, and had no reactions at all other than perhaps a chill. About 2-3 weeks later on 3/7/21 she started experiencing what they are calling muscle confusions. She feels a tapping sensation on her biceps and triceps and then starts with muscle cramps running down her right arm creating her fingers to cringe or come together or contract. This then travels down to her right leg to her quadriceps which cramps and convulse and travels to her calves which tighten up like a Charlie Horse and down her toes to where they contract as well. They are intermittent, scattered and sporadic. Sometimes she will get 2-3 a day, and then none at all and then a few days later a couple more. These contractions last 3-5 minutes. She had COVID back in April of 2020 and was hospitalized until August of 2020 with that. During that time she was on a ventilator for 60 days and on a breathing tube and coded and was out for about 30 minutes. She had an EEG of her brain in September and told that she was fine. her neurologist felt she should have another one due to these symptoms, and she had that and everything was normal. The doctor prescribed 500 mg twice a day of Levetiracetam. The seizures kind of regress a little and then they came back and he upped that medication to 1000 mg twice a day. The seizures still continue and have continued but is still taking the medication. He felt that she should know see an epileptic specialist and they have an APT for 5/27/21. These episodes are exhausting and wear her out. She was going to PT due to the weakness from being in the hospital for so long, and now she is fearful if she is going to fall and uses a walker and is having a setback in that progress. She is to continue therapy at home for now and to follow up with the Epilepsy specialist.

An 81-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in right arm on 26Feb2021 13:45 (lot number: EN6198) at the age of 81 years old, as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient did not receive any other vaccine four weeks prior to COVID vaccine. Patient mentioned she received her first COVID-19 vaccine on 26Feb2021. Then on 02Mar2021, she started having a back ache. Then by Friday, 05Mar2021 she started breaking out on her right side. She thought at first it was due to her using a heating pad for her back which was sore. Then on Sunday morning on 07Mar2021 she noticed a new breaking out area on her stomach. She thought she might have shingles. She was seen at her primary care doctor on 08Mar2021 and was told it was shingles. She was prescribed an antiviral drug now. She wanted to know if she should get the second COVID-19 shot and if the antiviral drug affect her getting the second shot. Patient noticed the breaking out on her right side towards her stomach and it may have started a day earlier. If it started on her back, she wasn't aware and she didn't feel it until Friday 05Mar2021. The breaking out started on her right side around towards her torso and a little backwards towards her back. On her waistline, lower than her waistline, a little bit lower. Right where her thigh meets her torso. Like her hip kind of like a crack there. The backache she can't feel any more, she wondered if the backache was a precursor to shingles or not. Referring to the backache, maybe she didn't notice it, maybe it was on 08Mar2021 that she didn't notice the backache anymore. Patient's daughter mentioned her mom was still on 07Mar2021. On Friday 05Mar2021 at bedtime she noticed the breaking out area, and it still burns, the bumps. The rash/breaking out spot is still there and hurts. They are bumps not blisters. When she looked at it this morning 09Mar2021 after taking three of the anti-viral pills the breaking out area is not as bright, maybe a little duller red color. She uses a magnifying glass when probed for details from the Patient Vaccination Card. She has low vision in both eyes due to macular degeneration. She went to the doctor on 08Mar2021. She was prescribed antiviral, Valacyclovir 1 gram tablet, take 1 tablet by mouth 3 times daily. She started taking this on 08Mar2021, was prescribed 21 pills for 7 days. NDC/Lot#/Expiry unknown, discard after Mar2022. Did not see on bottle to provide. When asked about if print was small it was clarified this was a blue bottle filled by the pharmacy. It is not a manufacturer bottle. She first saw the breaking out area on Friday 05Mar2021 night and didn't think anything about it until Sunday 07Mar2021 when she had a new break out. Her second COVID-19 injection is scheduled for 19Mar2021. She did have shingles shot about 5 years ago. And she knows they have a new one, but she has not taken the new one. Her doctor told her yesterday 08Mar2021 to get the shingles vaccine. She hasn't decided if she's getting the shingles vaccine or not. The event shingles required visit to Physician office. The patient recovered from backache on 08Mar2021; recovering from shingles; while outcome of the remaining events was unknown.

81 2021-05-31 joint pain A whole-body rash was evident 2-3 weeks after the first vaccine dose. Subject was unsure at the time... Read more
Close
A whole-body rash was evident 2-3 weeks after the first vaccine dose. Subject was unsure at the time if it was vaccine related. Severe swelling of hands and legs began the same day after the second vaccine dose with general malaise and concerns about fainting. Oral steroids were prescribed for 2 weeks, and progression of the symptoms seem to stabilize during steroid treatment. After steroid treatment, the symptoms resumed at full strength with swelling in the hands and legs causing the superficial skin to peel off and split down into the dermis with bleeding and pain. Joints in the hands and legs were painful. Severe swelling and pain in the hands and legs persisted for at least 6 weeks after the second vaccine dose. A diuretic was prescribed at about 4-5 weeks after the second vaccine dose. The subject is currently reporting improved symptoms.

So, she got an appointment for 2:30, by noon, it was just gone totally gone like if it never had been there. She cancelled the appointment then yesterday she got it back again and she could hardly walk but it wasn't as intense, it was really painful and hard for her to walk and it was around both legs and she doesn't know what to make of that, she went to rheumatologist because she thought she might be having muscle pain in arms from something else, he did some blood work (unknown results), he couldn't make anything out of it and he said he will look at the blood work and he gave her kind of a steroid cream to rub on arm (treatment) which she thought she had a problem but months ago (consumer was not sure). Now she couldn't sleep last night, it was so uncomfortable, and she had to go to the bathroom several times and again it really hurts to walk. So, that was what happened to her and she would not call that achiness of the flu at all. The one in the right leg was most intense, she could barely stand. For laboratory test, the 'BUN' test was outside of the parameters and after getting several tests he did, she wanted to see if she had some sort of rheumatoid thing and they are all in her record. This was not one of the typically adverse reactions that people reported at least according to what she read and according to aspects of it. Reporter stated that she was a Retired RN, and she had her first dose of the Pfizer Covid vaccine on 02Mar2021 at 11am, and she was scheduled for her second covid immunization on 23Mar2021. Caller has questions about side effects she experienced after the first dose and whether or not she should get the second immunization. Caller states she had a pretty strong reaction to the first injection. Caller states that she had the COVID disease in 22Oct2020, the caller went to the ER and had a positive COVID test because she had a fever, but she was sent home because her lungs were clear. She reported that both her son and her husband also got COVID around that time, but none of them had to be hospitalized. Stated that about an hour after her first injection, some soreness developed at the injection site. Later that afternoon she started to get a strong headache and her arm was getting sorer; in the evening, she started developing more joint pain in multiple joints, all over including, and especially, on her toes and feet; and her left arm was getting more sore, she got the chills, and she felt cold all the time, her temperature was 96.4; caller states that she also developed a tiny dime sized red spot at the injection site. Caller states that she also was thirsty, but she was a diabetic and that might have something to do with it. By the time it was time for her to go to sleep she was stiff and weak all over. She had neck stiffness, the feeling of being kind of stooped over. Caller was worried she would be unable to straighten up. The next morning, she still had weakness, stiffness and soreness, could hardly take a shower. She had to sit on side of tub and had to have her husband help her to get dressed. By about 10am the next day, everything started going away and by noon everything had pretty much cleared up completely and was gone. The pain in caller's feet and joints was gone by lunch and she did not have a fever. Caller states that at dinner that night, she was still weak though, and at the evening meal, she was so weak that she couldn't get up from the chair at the kitchen table alone. Once she was on her feet, she was okay, she could walk, but she uses a cane, especially when she was sick. About an hour or two later, she had a temperature of 99.4. But the next day, she didn't have a fever, and she could use that same chair without help. Caller states that she was fine by Friday and her blood sugar was 95, which was good. Caller states that she had a backache a few days following, but she has had backache before. Caller states that this was her history, she had the COVID, and she had a bleeding ulcer over a year ago now. Caller also saw a Cardiologist and had the watchman device implanted at the end of Sep2020, caller had this procedure to try and help get her off the Eliquis, which she had been on since having the stroke. Caller reports that she also had a Rectal bleed when she was put back on the Eliquis, and her doctors kept her on it because of the stroke. Caller states that she has silent A. Fib and that can throw little clots, so the doctors wanted her on a low dose of Eliquis but apparently that was too much for the caller too. Caller thinks the heart procedure is doing great and doing its job, but she was unable to go in for her follow up to the procedure, because she needed an esophageal echocardiogram to see if the device was sealed over by the heart muscle, and she couldn't have that until Jan2020, because she had to test negative for COVID twice. Caller states that her hemoglobin never really recovered more than 10 since her bleeding ulcer. But her hemoglobin went down to 7.4 and she was sent to the ER at the end of Jan2021, and she had two transfusions, and the next morning her hemoglobin went down to 7, the hospital staff thought that she must be bleeding. So the caller saw a GI doctor who said that the caller needed an endoscopy and colonoscopy to see where this was coming from, to make sure she was not bleeding from the ulcer. They saw the ulcer was healed but irritated, and the colonoscopy removed a couple polyps. The polyps were negative for cancer cells. After the caller had the COVID injection, she had blood in her stool. Caller went to the ER in the evening of 08Mar2021, and she stayed in the ER until the next morning. Caller states that the stool sample did show that there was some blood in her urine (captured as provided by the caller), and the ER did a CT of her abdomen, and they didn't see blood or diverticulitis. Caller does have a history of diverticulosis or internal hemorrhoids. Because things were going on last Fall, and things were rescheduled with the COVID disease, and things, the caller did not get her regular flu shot until 12Jan2021, because she needed two negative COVID tests prior to being able to get the Flu shot. She got two negative COVID tests on 24Dec2020 and 06Jan2021. Caller does not know if having had her flu shot in Jan2021, could have affected it. Caller was concerned and was wondering if she should take the second dose of the COVID vaccine or not. HCP Details: Caller hasn't spoken to her PCP since she was last in the hospital. She tried to call her HCP, but that office was getting a new computer system and they were having a high call volume for COVID stuff, so caller could not get through to them. Caller plans to email her doctor today. Everything has been overwhelming with all these things and people for doctors to juggle. Event Details: Caller reports that the soreness at her injection site, by the next morning, was up into her shoulder. Caller states that her niece, who was not a nurse, called the caller and told her to get the injection three fingers below the shoulder joint, because there were some instances of people getting injected into the shoulder joint. So, caller had soreness at the injection site, but within 24 hours, states that she was just sore all over, but it all went away by the afternoon the next day. Caller states that, she was told that she would have reactions more to the second injection than the first, so that was her concern, was she does not want to get the second injection and then it be worse than what she experienced. Caller had a lot of pain in her toes following the COVID injection, but she has diabetes that was well controlled, and she has neuropathy, and probably arthritis. But caller states that the pain in her toes was worse than normal, following receiving the COVID vaccine. Caller has had a bunionectomy, so she always has some numbness in the toe, and she fell and broke her ankle a few years later. But caller states that the very concerning thing was, following the COVID injection, the joint pain and soreness all over and weakness that she experienced. Caller had the stiffness together with some of the other things from her low hemoglobin anyway, as she has not fully recovered from the blood loss, but she was much better, and after the transfusions she had a hemoglobin of 10. And when caller went to the hospital lately, her hemoglobin was 9.4, and she was having it tested Tuesday morning again. Caller states that it was hard to say that everything she experienced was from the COVID vaccine, as she has a history of some of these things, including weakness. Caller finally got off the Eliquis when the hemoglobin went so low, she stopped the Eliquis maybe on 29Jan2021. Caller states that she was told by her Cardiologist that her symptoms at the time were from low Hemoglobin. Caller states that she was probably walking around with that low hemoglobin for a few days. Weakness: Caller states that at times she gets very fatigued, but she was not so weak right now. But caller states that weakness has been an up and down thing for her for the past few months, even before the COVID vaccine. Treatment: Caller took her normal Aspirin, but she did not take Tylenol even though she was told she could, and she did not take Allegra. She just took her normal medicines. History: When caller had her rectal bleed, she went into the ER on 08Mar2021, and she was sent home the next morning. Caller states that the ER was busy that evening and did not see the doctor until 10 or 11 that evening. But when the tests were finished up around 3am, the caller was told that she could go home or be admitted. Caller asked to go home but not until a little later in the morning, so she could call her family. Knee Bleed: Caller confirms it was aspirated and treated in the ER; she did not have to stay overnight. Caller saw orthopedic doctor a day or two later, and he did not order anything else. Caller walks with a cane now most the time because she is trying to avoid falling. Eliquis: Caller reports that the Eliquis was held for a few days after her GI bleed. She was taking 5mg twice a day from April or May2018. Caller had the GI bleed and the Eliquis was held for a few days and then she went back on it, then had rectal bleeding again. So, after that, caller's dose was reduced to 2.5mg twice day. The doctors did not want to take her off the Eliquis because of her prior stroke, so they just reduced her dose. The Eliquis had been preventing little TIAs and stuff in her hand and mouth and stuff. And that reduced dose was okay for a while. But caller states that she started getting those symptoms back, and several times a day she was getting the numbness, and she was scared she was going to have a stroke, so she said maybe because she was previously on mg twice a day, maybe she should up her dose to 7.5mg, and that worked well. So, caller took 5mg in the morning and 2.5mg in the evening. This was over a weekend, and on Monday the caller wrote her cardiologist, who said this dosing was not normally recommended, but if it was working for the caller, then that is okay. But then in July, the caller got the knee bleed. So, the doctors thought the caller's knee bleed was from the 2.5mg knee bleed but caller thinks she started to get that earlier because she had an episode that was similar before that, caller thought that episode in May or so was just arthritis. But, in Jul2020 her knee became swollen, very painful, and she could not get out of bed. Caller states that her son who was a weightlifter could not get her out of bed. She went to hospital via ambulance where her knee was aspirated. Caller reports that the Eliquis was not stopped due to the knee bleed, she was just told to go back to 2.5mg twice daily. Caller states that her heart doctor said that because she has had a stroke, she has to take the Eliquis to prevent stroke. Caller reports that she initially was not interested in the Watchman implant, but after all this, she decided to get that procedure so she could stop the Eliquis because she was a bleeder. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included colonoscopy: the ulcer was healed but irritated, endoscopy: the ulcer was healed but irritated, haemoglobin: 7.4 on Jan2021, haemoglobin: 7 on Jan2021. The outcome of sore arm and weakness was unknown, headache, stiffness/Neck stiffness, chills, soreness all over the body, moderate soreness at the injection site, Joint pain, felt cold, tiny red spot at injection site about the size of a dime were recovered on 03Mar2021 and back pain recovered on 09Mar2021.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available, a possible contributory role of the suspect vaccine BNT162B2 in triggering the onset of pain in arm,toe,headache,stiffness,chills,weakness,pain,joint pain,feeling cold,vaccination site erythema,pain and pain in toe. But also consider relevant medical history and concomittant drugs . The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate

10:05 am Pt received vaccine and was seated in observation area. Pt alert, interacting with staff and other pts. 10:15am Pt appears asleep, rouses with touch and when spoken to. Observation area nurse notified, provided pt with bottle of water and helped her take a drink. Nurse then notified pharmacist who came to pt's side. Pt given 25 mg benadryl caplet. Able to swallow it, needed assistance for holding water bottle. Pt breathing regular, pulse regular and easily palpable. 10:25 Pt increasingly lethargic. Nurse and pharmacist with pt. Lips and tongue slowly swelling, responsiveness decreasing. Pharmacist called 911. 10:30am Pt's daughter administered epipen 30mg, L outer thigh. Swelling of lips and tongue quickly resolving. Pt lethargy increasing. Increasingly slow to open eyes and respond to questions. Pulse and breathing continue regular. EMS arrived on scene approx 10:35-10:40. BP 80/60, NSR, pulses palpable, pupils reactive, able to answer questions but slow to respond and weak voice. Pt transferred to Medical Center. In ER pt given IV solumedrol, IV fluids, CXR, EKG. Awake and oriented, arms shaking, weak, requires assistance to stand, intermittently drowsy. Admitted for observation. 3/3/21 pt preparing for discharge, BP extremely high. Pt given metoprolol, BP increased, tachycardia increased, pt very drowsy. Continued to monitor, given Lisinopril, bp decreasing. Pt feeling much stronger, alert, interacting with staff and daughter. Discharged home.

a bad stiff neck on my left side; one of my lymph nodes were swollen; the pain on my left side of my neck; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (the patient). A non-pregnant 82-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: UNKNOWN), via an unspecified route of administration, in the left arm on 30Jan2021 at 10:45 AM (at the age of 82-years) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma, and hypertension. The patient did not have any known allergies to medications, food, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medication taken within two weeks of vaccination was not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 03Feb2021 at 05:00 AM, the patient woke up with a bad stiff neck on her left side. When she touched her neck, she realized that one of her lymph nodes were swollen, and pain on her left side of my neck. The patient was not sure whether the pain on her left side of her neck had anything to do with this swollen node. After four days, she still had the swollen node and a lot of pain on her left side of her neck. No treatment was given. The clinical outcome of bad stiff neck on my left side, one of her lymph nodes were swollen, and pain on her left side of my neck was not recovered. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. Information on lot number was requested.

Concomitant medications included influenza vaccine (FLU) on an unspecified date for an unspecified indication, blood pressure medicine, and hormone medication since she had her thyroid removed in 1970. The patient did not receive vaccinations within 4 weeks prior. The reporter mentioned that the patient has experienced body aches on 12Feb2021, nausea on 13Feb2021 and she woke wet from sweat on 16Feb2021. It was mentioned that her neuropathy was elevated to an unbearable level on 12Feb2021. She didn't feel it the first day. When talking about the neuropathy, the reporter stated that it was like something stabbing her from the knees to the toes. She has to lay in bed. Her legs hurt so bad she is unable to stand and can't sit for long. She woke wet with sweat twice. The first time was on 16Feb2021 and again on 19 or 20Feb2021. She had a flu shot on an unspecified date when they came out. The events did not require emergency room or physician's office visit. The reporter mentioned that her mother in law who was due tomorrow for the second dose and wanted to cancel because their doctor advised them to wait for at least a month to receive the second dose. According to her, her mother in law was sick for almost 3 weeks after the first dose, her mother in law experienced severe muscle ache and her neuropathy flared up on an unspecified date in 2021. The outcome of the events sweaty was recovered on an unspecified date in 2021, as for the event nausea was recovered on 01Mar2021 while muscle ache was unknown. The outcome of the other events was recovering. The following information on the batch/lot number has been requested.

Adds she was so cold besides four sweaters and her heating blankets she was still so cold, she does get chilled a lot but this was so obvious, States she had the joint pain all over her body but especially in the joint of her thigh/hip and it went down to her legs. She is not sure when went away because she took two extra strength tylenol and it got better. Adds she lives alone because her husband passes, and she had to use a cane and it was really difficult. Close
I had a lot of reaction from the COVID shot. I had a bad bad flare with my arthritis by being off of the Xeljanz; I have been extremely fatigued; I had a few headaches which is extremely rare for me to have a headache; Can't use left hand/Painful to sit down and straighten the leg up; Right leg and knee and joints are so swollen; A lot of pain; Hard to get up from a chair or get in and out of bed; This is a spontaneous report from Pfizer Sponsored Program. A contactable 82 year old female consumer (patient) reported for herself, took BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE Solution for injection, lot number EN6206, Expiration date were unknown), via unspecified route anatomical site of injection administration stated by the patient was Left upper arm on 18Mar2021 for COVID-19 immunization and had a co suspect as Tofacitinib Citrate( XELJANZ) as prescribed 5 mg tablets which was stopped by the patient to take BNT162B2. The patient's medical history reported was rheumatoid arthritis, Chronic kidney disease, AFibrillation and unspecified allergy. The concomitant medications included were Paracetamol(TYLENOL) was taken for pain whenever she needed. Apixaban(ELIQUIS) as 5mg twice daily, Bumetanide(BUMETANIDE) as ongoing, VITAMIN D3 as 1000 units daily, Ubidecarenone (COQ-10) 30mg once daily, Metoprolol(METOPROLOL)50mg twice daily, Prednisone(PREDNISONE) 5mg once a day, Cyanocobalamin(VITAMIN B12 CYANOCOBALAMIN) ongoing, Digoxin(DIGOXIN) 0.125mg once daily tablet ongoing. She had to take anit-histamines at this time of the year. They said she should not take Covid 19 BNT162B2 and Tofacitinib Citrate( XELJANZ) at the same time. She had been off it for two weeks and she had a lot of reaction from the COVID shot. She had a bad flare with her arthritis by being off of the XELJANZ but she was back on it for a little while. She had to delay her second dose of the vaccine because of it and that she would have to go off of it for another two weeks when she get the second dose for 8Apr2021. She was not sure if she should try as her right leg was in bad pain. stated that she had been off XELJANZ to take the COVID 19 shot. Patient was afraid to take that second shot. She had been extremely fatigued and had a few headaches which was extremely rare for her to have a headache. They did not last very long, they were more of like just pain in her head and uncomfortable for a few minutes and it went away. Her main concern was that her hands were so swollen, that it was very difficult to take care of herself. And her legs as well as it was hard to get up from a chair or get in and out of bed as it was painful. She did not know what to do as to go off of the XELJANZ for two weeks, which unfortunately both are Pfizer medications. She could not use her left hand and her right leg, knee and joints were so swollen. It was painful to sit down and straighten the leg up and she was in a lot of pain. She was supposed to stay off of this XELJANZ right after taking the first shot which she did, did not take XELJANZ until 3Apr2021 which was a full two weeks period, that was her Rheumatoid Arthritis. Outcome of the events was unknown. Additional information has been requested.

Severe nausea; weight loss; stomach pain; bladder infection; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse (patient). An 82-year-old female patient not pregnant received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 25Mar2021 13:30 (Lot Number: EN6208) as single dose (at the age of 82-years-old) for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included tachycardia, hypothyroidism and Covid prior vaccination (date unknown). Concomitant medications in two weeks prior to the vaccination included metoprolol succinate (TOPROL), levothyroxine sodium (LEVOXYL). The patient previously took sulfamethoxazole, trimethoprim (BACTRIUM DS) and experienced drug hypersensitivity. Patient did not receive other vaccine in four weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 30Mar2021 patient experienced severe nausea, weight loss, stomach pain and bladder infection. Patient had three visits to primary care doctor (dr), one clinic visit for intravenous (iv) fluids, emergency room (ER) Visit and hospital admission. Patient was admitted for three days in response to the events (dates were not provided). Events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care, Hospitalization, Life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event), Disability or permanent damage. The patient underwent laboratory tests and procedures which included sars-cov-2 test (Nasal Swab) negative on 14Apr2021 and sars-cov-2 test (Nasal Swab) negative on 16Apr2021. Patient had not recovered from the events, at the time of the report.; Sender's Comments: Based on the available information it is unlikely that BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) contributed to events occurrence. The reported events more likely represent intercurrent medical conditions unrelated to Covid-19 vaccination. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

could hardly walk; arm was very sore; stomach was upset; Slight Headache; Diarrhea; Slight fever; Muscle ache; felt bad; Sore throat; bled after her injection; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. An 82-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; Lot: ER8727), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 25Mar2021 between 15:30-16:00 (at the age of 82-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization; apixaban (ELIQUIS) via an unspecified route of administration at 5 mg twice a day from an unspecified date in 2018 and ongoing as a blood thinner/for the heart. Medical history included diabetes (started a couple of years before 2018), arthritis, lupus since 2020 (started just 6 months ago), high cholesterol, heart disease, all ongoing; as well as aortic valve replacement and pacemaker in 2016; she had all 3 types of arthritis: osteo, rheumatoid, and the one with the rashes, she has had aches and pains for a long time; arthritis pain; heart surgery in 2016; COVID-19 in the last part of Jul2020 to the first 2-3 weeks in Aug2020 (and then tested negative on 19Aug2020) with the following symptoms: bad headache, muscle aches, diarrhea, loss of smell and taste, "just about everything" for almost 4 weeks, autoimmune disease, diuretic and muscle relaxant therapy. Ongoing concomitant medications included glimepiride for diabetes from 2014, potassium tablet as a diuretic from 2016, furosemide as a diuretic from 2016, metoprolol for the heart from 2016, atorvastatin for cholesterol, hydrocodone for pain, tizanidine as a muscle relaxant, cinnamomum verum (CINNAMON) capsule, ascorbic acid (VITAMIN C), fish oil, ubidecarenone (COQ-10), vitamin D3, paracetamol (TYLENOL ARTHRITIS PAIN) tablet for arthritis pain, and an unspecified multivitamin. There were no additional vaccines administered on the same date or 4 weeks prior to BNT162B2. On25Mar2021, the patient bled after her injection, the blood started running down her arm when they pulled the needle out. The patient experienced sore throat on 25Mar2021 at 22:00, which was not excruciating, and the patient did not take anything for it. After waking the next morning, the sore throat was gone. The patient took paracetamol daily in the morning, and she wasn't sure if that was why her sore throat went away or not. She stated that when she had COVID disease the paracetamol didn't help her sore throat or headache at that time. The patient then started to have muscle ache on 26Mar2021 and a slight fever, never over 98 degrees, and she felt bad. The patient's normal temperature was around 97 degrees. The patient experienced a slight headache on 27Mar2021, diarrhea for 1 day and stomach upset on 27Mar2021 and then diarrhea again on 31Mar2021 for 1 day. The patient didn't take anything for the diarrhea, it was not that severe. The muscle aches continued in the upper part of legs, thighs, upper arms to her elbows. The patient had never had a hurting like that in her muscles and on an unspecified date, the patient could hardly walk since it was hurting so bad. On an unspecified date, the patient's arm was very sore. The events did not require an emergency room or physician office visit. The patient did call her doctor because she was hurting so bad who informed her that he had heard of other people who had the disease were having a reaction to the first vaccine. The action taken in response to the events for apixaban was dose not changed. The clinical outcome of sore throat was resolved on 26Mar2021 (duration 1 day), muscle ache was resolved on 03Apr2021 (duration 8 days), slight headache was resolved on 04Apr2021 (duration 8 days), diarrhea occurring on 27Mar2021 was resolved on 28Mar2021 and diarrhea occurring on 31Mar2021 was resolved on 01Apr2021, slight fever was resolved on 26Mar2021 (duration 1 day), stomach was upset was resolved on an unspecified date, and of could hardly walk, arm was very sore, bled after her injection, felt bad was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

82 2021-05-10 joint pain, joint swelling Left knee started to swell and reports that it is painful; Left knee started to swell and reports th... Read more
Close
Left knee started to swell and reports that it is painful; Left knee started to swell and reports that it is painful; It is is stiff; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 82-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, lot number and expiry date unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date (at the age 82-year-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient states that about a week and a half to two weeks after, her left knee started to swell and reports that it is painful. She states that it is not an "excruciating" pain but does report that it is really bothering her and that it is stiff. She is concerned that this may be an autoimmune response to the vaccine. She also mentions that she received her second dose of the vaccine the day before yesterday. The patient states that when she took Tylenol and placed ice on it, the swelling seemed to go down a little bit and does not know if she should continue with icing it and resting it, or if she should see her doctor. Outcome of the event was not reported. No follow-up attempts are needed. Information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

Patient started to experience left arm pain hours after the vaccination on 05/04/2021, and the pain gradually moved to the patient's left chest wall, anterior chest and right chest wall, patient was having shallow breathing limited by pleuritic pain, presented to the ED on 5/10/2021 and was diagnosed with acute bilateral nonobstructive pulmonary emboli based on CT angiogram chest.

This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 82-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: ER8737; Expiration Date: Jul2021, NDC number: Unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 07Apr2021 (at the age of 82-year-old) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included had headaches most of her life, she knew it was her cervical spine because of bone spurs, arthritis, and bulging disc; she has also had change in vision, she was coming down the road from seeing her cardiologist and was looking down the road, out of right eye the road continued straight, but out of her left eye it looked like the road was turning off to the left, it was actually going straight, her eye doctor had told her that her eyes were no longer compatible, she was having five prisms put in her glasses, the neurologist was concerned, the eye thing started four or five months ago; she had shrunk to 4 foot 10 inches or 4 foot 11 inches, she used to be 5 foot 2 inches and shrunk because she had osteoporosis. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Patient reported that she had diarrhea one day in Apr2021. She started coughing some yesterday (14Apr2021). Then she was coughing more a little later. That was not what she would normally do. 14Apr2021, she was moving her winter clothes out to her summer clothes. She worked for three to four hours. Then she got so sore and was hurting all over. She felt the same this morning (15Apr2021). She was wondering if muscle aches could be a part of it. She was really hurting last night (14Apr2021) all over. She woke up this morning and felt sore. She was better now. It was from the waist up to the rib cage and all the way around. It was general, all over. She felt so badly last night (14Apr2021) and didn't feel great this morning. Another reason she was calling was because she saw her neurologist three days before and he scheduled her for an MRI of her head and brain. She had the appointment for the MRI on the 21Apr2021. She had been told that particular test was a magnet test and not radiation. She wanted to make sure there was nothing in the vaccine. They were not sure what the vaccine was going to do. They were not sure what was dealing with. Diarrhea started a couple of days before in Apr2021 when she was out of town, just for one day. It had stopped, she had recovered completely from the diarrhea. Coughing started on 14Apr2021. It was kind of a deeper cough. She had a little coughing 15Apr2021, but mainly body aches that started late 14Apr2021. She hobbled around and went to bed and got up to go to the bathroom and was having a hard time walking because she was so sore on 14Apr2021. The soreness was all over the body. She was having the MRI on her brain and head because she had been having headaches in Apr2021. She has had headaches most of her life. She had seen him (neurologist) several years before. She knew it was her cervical spine because of bone spurs, arthritis, and bulging disc. The doctor said that was the reason for a headache, but this was a different headache. It extended from behind her eye on the left side to the back of her head. It came on suddenly and she would have it for two to three days. Then that side of the head when she was turning in the left direction was sore and hurts. The headaches that felt different had been on and off for the past several months. She would have them for 3 days running and then maybe get a reprieve. She didn't want to take the second vaccine and had that on top of each other with the MRI. She wondered if she could take the second vaccine a little later. She was not comfortable getting it around the same time of the MRI. The outcome of the event diarrhea was recovered in Apr2021, sore was recovering, outcome of the other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

In February I went to the hospital and 4 doctors looked at me, I stayed there one day overnight . I think I got the whole vial.

pain in her lower back that is "a lot stronger" than what it normally is/She said that the pain in her lower back is a little stronger than it normally is; She gets pain all the time.; muscle pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 82-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 30Apr2021 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included osteoporosis, sciatica, pain in extremity, back pain. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced pain in her lower back that is "a lot stronger" than what it normally is/she said that the pain in her lower back is a little stronger than it normally is (non-serious) in May2021 with outcome of not recovered, she gets pain all the time (non-serious) in 2021 with outcome of unknown and muscle pain (non-serious) in 2021 with outcome of unknown. The patient stated that she normally suffers from osteoporosis and sciatica where the pain goes to her legs. However, since receiving her first dose, she has been experiencing pain in her lower back that is "a lot stronger" than what it normally is (she specified that she noticed the back pain getting worse around 5 days after the vaccine). Caller mentions that she has taken injections for the pain in the past and now feels that she is going to have to go back to get them again. Caller states she read that muscle pain and joint pain can occur with the vaccine but she is not sure if that is what is happening to her and would like to know if this is a side effect of the vaccine. She stated also that it can cause joint pain and muscle pain and said that this was muscle pain. She states that she is unsure about getting her second dose of the vaccine because of her side effects. Caller mentions that she has taken the flu vaccine for years and never had any side effects. The patient had not recovered from the back pain aggravated; the outcome of the other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

An 82-year-old female patient received second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6199, Expiration date: Jun2021), via an unspecified route on 13Mar2021 (age at the time 82-year-old) as 2nd dose, single dose in the left arm for covid-19 immunization. The patient medical history included osteoarthritis, fibromyalgia (reported that she was diagnosed with fibromyalgia close to 20 years ago, between 15-20 years ago). The patient concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: EL9269), via an unspecified route on 20Feb2021 at 10:00 (age at the time 82-year-old) as 1st dose, single dose in the left arm for covid-19 immunization. On 13Mar2021, the patient experienced armed was hurting, armed was just a teensy bit sore at the injection site, and the next day, on 14Mar2021 she had diarrhea and her knees hurt her and had chills and mild fever, was cold and felt a little liked balance was off. Patient reported that the next day, 15Mar2021, she was fine, on 16Mar2021 it started from the top of her neck and her balance was off, she felt fuzzy-headed, fuzzy headed feeling was now not so much, but she would have a day where she was so tired that she doesn't wanted to do anything. Patient experienced periods of tiredness where she did not want to do anything was reported as worsened and reporting increased forgetfulness in addition to her intermittent light headedness. Patient reported that she called the pharmacist who informed her that some reactions would go on for a few weeks. She reported that she was a senior, and most seniors had a problem where they couldn't remember a word then blinked and could've thought of it. She reported that the thing that bothers her was that her problem remembering words was getting worse and the problem remembering words had gotten worse from her baseline after she received the covid-19 vaccine, but it had stayed the same since originally worsening from baseline. Patient reported that the difficulty remembering words worsened around the same time that her fuzzy or lightheaded feeling began, and temperature was 99. 7. Patient explained that her armed did tended to hurt a little and that she received her shot in the affected armed and she was not sure if the diarrhea lasted the second day or not, but it resolved completely. she had a teeny problem with her knees and the covid-19 vaccine really nailed it. She reported that since she received the second dosed of the covid-19 vaccine, her knees had been terrible. She reported that what's really bothering her now was her knees. She reported that her knees were hurting so bad that she could've hardly walked. It was reported that patient visited to physician office. The outcome of the events diarrhea was resolved on Mar2021, armed was hurting was resolved on 14Mar2021, chills, mild fever, cold was resolved on 15Mar2021, felt a little liked balance was off was resolving, her knees hurt, so tired I did not want to be done anything was not recovered and other events was unknown. Information on lot/batch number was available. Additional information had been requested.

Experienced sever headahce for a week and went to ER for Ct scan . No stroke or anyerism . Then the heavy bloody mucus went into my bronchi and lungs causing shortness of breath and weakness...given a pneumonia antiibiotic . My left hip was very sore and it got worse; My left hip was very sore and it got worse; The pain was so bad I couldn't move and I also had a lot of pain in my right shoulder; The pain was so bad I couldn't move and I also had a lot of pain in my right shoulder; I think it exacerbated, it kicks in my immune system; Pfizer shot affected my immune system and started this but this is my guess; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 82-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EM9809), via an unspecified route of administration on 26Feb2021 as 2nd dose, single for COVID-19 immunization (age at the time of vaccination was 82-year-old). The patient's medical history included blood pressure and arthritis. Concomitant medications included hydrochlorothiazide (HYDROCHLOROTHIAZIDE) taken at 12.5 mg for blood pressure. Historical vaccine included BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EL9264), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunization vaccination. On an unspecified date in 2021, the patient stated after the second shot I got some side effects and a few days after it began, and it was my left hip was very sore and it got worse. The patient made an appointment with the orthopaedist but before she could get to see him, she had to go to the Hospital in the ambulance because the pain was so bad she could not move and she also had a lot of pain in my right shoulder which went on a couple of weeks, just beginning to light up a little bit that day. So, she thought it was a side effect because I thought it was exacerbated, it kicked in my immune system so that was what I was thinking it was and I just reported it. The patient stated regarding outcome as yes but it has alleviated quite a bit I mean it was very bad , quite a lot actually today anyways it's pretty good and I have been on Prednisone (treatment), I am in the middle of taking that. I started taking it (Prednisone) 10 days ago. I have another week to go on it's a reduce dose you know you take 2 a day to 5 days, when you take you take two twice a day for five days then you take one twice a day for five days and you take one a day for five days." When probed if consumer is taking any medication other than Prednisone, consumer stated, "Not for the pain, I mean I do have other medications beside Prednisone. I am taking Hydrochlorothiazide (Clarified as concomitant medication) and nothing else. "Regarding start date of event the patient stated, "I can only give you an approximation it was about maybe four or five days later approximately. I started felling sore on my hip and then it gone worse. From 02Mar would be a good guess. She was guessing that the Pfizer shot affected her immune system and started but this is my guess, I am not a doctor. Treatment medication included Prednisone for all the events expect I thought it exacerbated, it kicked in my immune system. Outcome of all the events was reported as recovering and unknown for the event I thought it exacerbated, it kicked in my immune system. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

swollen lips; tightening of her neck was more intense after receiving the vaccine, it felt like the left half of her throat was tightening; tightening of her neck was more intense after receiving the vaccine, it felt like the left half of her throat was tightening; tightening of her neck was more intense after receiving the vaccine, it felt like the left half of her throat was tightening; chills and shaking; chills and shaking; red dot on the inside of her throat; she took the Benadryl thinking it was an allergic reaction; swelling on left side where the nodule was removed; burning sensation in her left arm; ear pain; nausea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 83-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), intramuscular on Left deltoid (upper left arm) on 13Jan2021 14:00 at single dose to prevent COVID. Medical history included sulfa drug reaction, high blood pressure diagnosed in 1970s or 1980s (States she was in the hospital in the 70s or 80s. She has high blood pressure which has been difficult to control, she is seeing a cardiologist and he is content with her blood pressure readings, her diastolic is normal), incontinence, thyroid nodule surgery a year ago (2020), thyroid nodule, ten operations in the last 3 years, tightening in her neck repeatedly since her thyroid nodule surgery, scratchy throat problems since a week prior to getting the vaccine (from Jan2021) and post nasal drip and she has had that for years and when they operated nothing worked. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took cipro where she could not breathe. She does not have lot, ndc or expiration date to provide for any of the medications mentioned that she had a reaction to. She took the Asiatic flu shot in 1958 (as reported), she had a reaction and high fever, weak and pale. This occurred when she was 19 years old. She took the Pfizer covid 19 shot last Wednesday. She stated that it could be her but she got a few of the reported side effects. What she found most important was that she had swollen lips that started about an hour after receiving the vaccine. Last night (13Jan2021) she got the chills and was shaking during the night. She had mild chills in the last few days, during the night she was shaking from the chills but it may have been cold at night, reporting the chills have subsided but she can feel it a little bit. In Jan2021, she felt a burning sensation in her left arm which lasted about two minutes. She got a piercing earache in her left ear for about two minutes and then it went away. She experienced nausea within two minutes, but she ate the ginger candy she had in her purse and her nausea went away. She could have something else too since she has a red dot on the inside of her throat. She did not see it was red before last night (13Jan2021). She took Benadryl on Wednesday afternoon after she called the doctor's office, she took the Benadryl thinking it was an allergic reaction, her swollen lips seemed like it was improved but now it was minor. She has had the tightening in her neck repeatedly since her thyroid nodule surgery but she felt the tightening of her neck was more intense after receiving the vaccine, it felt like the left half of her throat was tightening, it is sort of still ongoing but states it has sort of improved. Patient also mentioned swelling on left side where the nodule was removed. She was asking if she should get the second dose. She has an appointment for her second dose. She has never had much problems till she was 80. Her husband tested negative for covid and she tested negative in Aug2020 prior to one of her surgeries. Patient stated that she is 83 but she is biologically younger. She felt pretty good normally. The events did not require emergency room visit or physician office visit. No prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). The outcome of the events burning sensation in her left arm, ear pain and nausea was recovered in Jan2021; Swollen lips, tightening of her neck was more intense after receiving the vaccine, it felt like the left half of her throat was tightening, chills was recovering; and unknown for the other events. Information about batch/lot number has been requested.

My mom received the Covid 19 vaccine on Jan 5, 2021 and became very about a week later. I was informed that she tested positive for Covid 19 on January 14th. One January 17th she became very tired and weak and would not eat. Hospice called me and told me that she was in a decline state. I saw her on January 25 and 26 and she was just sleeping and could not open her eyes. Her vitals were good and she seemed to understand when I talked to her - she would squeeze my hand and moan but she could not talk or open her eyes. My mom passed away on January 27, 2021 just 22 days after receiving the Covid 19 vaccine. She was very think to begin with and being to weak and tired to eat resulted in her losing even more weight. Some of the other residents were given fluids to help and they recovered. My mom was not given fluids. I believe there were 20 deaths in her care home for the month of January when they vaccinated. This was an alarming number of deaths for the home. The facility had very few Covid deaths in 2019 and 2020. I asked every week if they had any Covid and or Covid deaths and this amount was shocking to me and the workers there.

83 2021-02-28 back pain Patient received the injection approximately 1:27PM on Friday, February 26, 2021. She felt fine unt... Read more
Close
Patient received the injection approximately 1:27PM on Friday, February 26, 2021. She felt fine until about 8PM Friday, Feb 26. At that time, she had feeling of malaise but did not check for fever. She went to bed and fell asleep. Upon arising on Saturday, February 27, 2021, she felt feverish and had a backache. Her fever was first checked about 11:30AM by her son and it was 101 degrees. During the afternoon, about 3PM, she ran a higher fever (102 degrees). The family consulted her primary care physician, who advised hydration and a Tylenol. After talking with the physician, about 4pm, the family gave her a 500 mg Tylenol, which brought the fever down to just under 100 degrees by 8pm Saturday night. She also had aching legs at that time. but no longer had a backache. She slept Saturday night and awakened on Sunday, Feb 28, with a fever of 99 degrees. Around Noon another Tylenol 500 mg tablet was administered. During Sunday afternoon, the fever dropped to around 98.2 (Patient has a normal temperature of 97.3 or 97.4, well documented). On Monday, March 1, 2021, at 11:00am, her temperature was normal, 97.4. She said she still felt tired and her legs "don't feel quite right". However, our family feels she is doing much better and she has enough energy to do some of her normal activities and participate in conversation.

83 2021-03-28 neck pain Starting approximately one week after the first dose of vaccine, my mother began suffering what she ... Read more
Close
Starting approximately one week after the first dose of vaccine, my mother began suffering what she describes as "episodes" of chest pain, neck pain (front and back), pain going down her arms, pain up into her jaw that are very sudden onset and cause her to have to lay down and rest until the episode is over. Timing of these episodes are random, but seem to occur when she first gets up in the morning or after she takes a shower or has been active. They lasts between 3 and 7 minutes and then completely resolve. She has never had any similar symptoms. She reports that these episodes occur between 4-6 times during the course of 24 hours.

An 83 years old female patient received 1st dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6202), via an unspecified route of administration on 02Mar2021 at age of 83 years old at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included hip surgery a few months ago and she was still kind of stiff and sore. Concomitant medications included lisinopril at low dose 10 mg once daily taken for blood pressure abnormal about 10 years ago; clopidogrel bisulfate (PLAVIX) taken for transient ischaemic attack from 2012 (she believed it was a around that time); acetylsalicylic acid (ASPIRIN LOW) at low dose (she began taking this before the Lisinopril so it has been several years).The patient mentioned that she received her 1st dose of the vaccine on 02Mar2021 and everything was fine that day and the day after. At late in the day on 04Mar2021, she experienced a lot of problems which she mentioned was the worst experience in her life. She was 99% sure it was from the vaccine because she didn't experience anything like that before getting the vaccine. She mentioned that she experienced side effects all night like her heart beating really fast, a headache, a stiff neck, her nerves pounding all throughout her body, and a blood pressure of 174/78. She mentioned that it was the worst she's felt so far as compared to going to the ER, as she's experienced before. She did not go to the ER as she could not drive herself and she was living alone. She mentioned that she better the next day although it was not totally gone, she was a little shake and kind of weak. As of calling, she said that she was feeling okay and better than yesterday (07Mar2021) in which the effects were still present. She mentioned that it was horrible, very scary, she was very ill, very uncomfortable, really bad, and didn't want to go through that again. She didn't know if she would make it through the night. She was asking for what to do and asking if there needed to be an adjustment for her dose because she was a very small person. She didn't want to have the 2nd shot if she went through that again. It was the worst experience of her life. She was not sure what to do now about her second shot. She had the first shot 02Mar2021 and everything was fine, 03Mar2021 she was okay but on 04Mar2021 she had, by night time, she had a lot of scary things that had never happened to her before. Her heart was pounding she could hear it in her ears. Her head, her neck felt stiff and her head felt heavy, her whole body felt heavy and like the nerves in her whole body were just aggravated, it was hard to explain. She had ringing in her ears. Her blood pressure was 174/78 and she was just afraid to have the second shot, it was scary, it was really bad. She was wondering if the amount of the vaccine was too much for her. She confirmed it was the evening 04Mar2021 when all this began. She said all of this was pretty well recovered at this point. She said the day after that happened, she was shaky but today (08Mar2021) she was fine. She did not know what it would be medications they are looking for but she was on normal medicine for old people she guesses. This was so bad that she really was not going to take the second dose unless they can tell her if she should or that they should give her less or something like that. The outcome of events was recovered in Mar2021.
83 2021-03-30 polymyalgia rheumatica polymyalgia rheumatica; RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP; RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP; ... Read more
Close
polymyalgia rheumatica; RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP; RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP; RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. An 83-year-old female no pregnant patient received first dose BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. No pregnant at time of vaccination. Medical history included Hypothyroidism, known allergies: Morphine. No covid prior vaccination. Concomitant medications included Levothyroxine. No other vaccine in four weeks. In Feb2021, since receiving vaccination, patient developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP. Responded to prednisone. Patient insists no symptoms until she received first dose. AE resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care, Hospitalization for 2 days. Lab data included Nasal Swab in Mar2021: Negative. Medrol/prednisone were received. Outcome of the event was recovering. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on reported events cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP that have significantly worsened after 2nd dose of vaccine; Developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP that have significantly worsened after 2nd dose of vaccine; Developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP that have significantly worsened after 2nd dose of vaccine; Developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP that have significantly worsened after 2nd dose of vaccine; Developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP that have significantly worsened after 2nd dose of vaccine; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. An 83-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot umber ad expiration date were not reported) as a single dose, with route of administration and therapy date unspecified, for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included hypothyroidism. Concomitant medications included levothyroxine. The patient previously took morphine, and had allergies; and the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number and expiration date were not reported) on an unspecified date for COVID-19 immunization, and had polymyalgia rheumatica, RS3PE, elevated ESR and elevated CRP. On an unspecified date in 2021, after the second dose of vaccination, the patient's developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP have significantly worsened. The reported events have resulted into doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient was hospitalized on an unspecified date in 2021 for two days due to the reported events. The patient had received methylprednisolone (MEDROL) and prednisone as treatment for the reported events. The outcome of the events, 'developed symptoms consistent with polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP have significantly worsened', was recovering. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination; and had a nasal swab test in Mar2021 that was negative post-vaccination. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Considering the plausible temporal association, a causal association between the reported 'polymyalgia rheumatica and RS3PE including elevated ESR and CRP ' (aggravated, already reported after the first dose of vaccine) and BNT162B2 cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

83 2021-04-21 joint pain After several days of pain in left shoulder, on the morning of 4/11/21 a harsh rash was noted on the... Read more
Close
After several days of pain in left shoulder, on the morning of 4/11/21 a harsh rash was noted on the back next to the shoulder blade as well as a similar bright red rash on the thorax front. A visit to a Now Care facility on that Sunday morning confirmed a diagnosis of shingles, and Valacyclovir was prescribed, 1 gm. tablet every 8 hours for 7 days. In the following 4 days, as the medication was taken, the rash gradually spread around the side of the thorax from front to back and under the left arm. The pain remains as of 4/22/21.

She states after 24 hours (03Apr2021) it did go away. The patient asks does this happen to other people? 83 2021-05-24 joint swelling Six days after the second dose of Pfizer I started experiencing shortness of breath so I went to the... Read more
Close
Six days after the second dose of Pfizer I started experiencing shortness of breath so I went to the ER and took a chest x-ray and had fluid in my lungs. Doctors discovered I had Atrial Fibrillation. In January I had an Echo Cardiogram and none of the previous described diagnoses were present then. I was admitted; doctors attempted to shock my heart back into rhythm several times but were unsuccessful. Therefore, I was put on Eliquis (5mg) and a water pill to get rid of the fluid in my lungs (and swollen ankles). I was hospitalized for 9 days where I was evaluated through numerous tests. Eventually it was suggested that I undergo the Watchman's Procedure to get off blood thinners. Everything went well with that surgery on Thursday May 20th; complications arose after the surgery: heart rate and blood pressure spike, lungs started filling up with fluid. Ended up in ICU for four days. I still have a problem with my lungs despite having no history of lung problems and I am now dealing with AFIB. This all started 6 days after my second shot.

On unknown date in 2021, the patient also had body chills. She wants to know how long this will last and was she still eligible for the second shot. Patient used Tylenol & cold compresses for adverse events. The patient did not require medical intervention/ emergency department visit/ hospitalization and intensive care unit admission. The outcome of the events was resolving except for "chills" which was found to be unknown. No PQC involved. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

An 83-years-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number and expiration date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 21Feb2021 as single dose for covid-19 immunisation (at the age of 83 years). The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced right leg bothering her and mind went blank and she was unable to think of her email address to provide on an unspecified date, arm soreness and arm soreness was getting worse/arm was sore on 21Feb2021. The patient received her first dose of the Covid-19 vaccine on 21Feb2021, and her arm was sore on the 21Feb2021 (that night) and on the 22Feb2021 (next day) but went away. The pain came back two and a half weeks later, and her 2nd shot was scheduled for this 13Mar2021 (Saturday). It seemed like it was okay after the first two days, but now it was back. Her arm had been sore, all week; on 10Mar2021 (today) it was really sore. She also mentioned her right leg was bothering her (start date: unspecified), but she didn't think that's related to the vaccine. She did not know if it was like just really dull before and she did not really notice it. It seemed like it was okay, and all of a sudden, each day she felt a little sore and today was really sore. She confirmed after the vaccine she had arm soreness and the arm soreness was getting worse. On 13Mar2021 (Saturday), it would be 3 weeks since she received the first dose. She took ADVIL as treat-ment, and but it didn't seem to help (Usually, ADVIL helps her). She did have TYLENOL and wanted to know if you can alternate TYLENOL and ADVIL. While attempting to provide email she commented her mind went blank and she was unable to think of her email address to provide (start date: unspecified). In concern to height, she thought she had shrunk. She wanted to know if it was normal for the pain to come back after about 2 and a half, almost 3 weeks and since this arm was sore, will she have to get it in her other arm. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of arm soreness and arm soreness was getting worse/arm was sore. The outcome for arm soreness and arm soreness was getting worse/arm was sore was not recovered, and for another event was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch cannot be obtained.

This 84-Year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) on 15Jan2021 at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included ulcer, allergy, cholesterol, vertigo, cancer. Concomitant products included omeprazole at 40 mg for Ulcer, spironolactone at 25 mg for water pill, montelukast at 10 mg, 1x/day (in the morning) for allergy, simvastatin at 40 mg, 1x/day (in the evening) for cholesterol and piracetam (MECLIVIN) 25 mg, 2x/day one in the morning and one at night for Vertigo. The patient was hard of hearing, needed hearing aid and didn't have them. And wanted to say that when the patient got the vaccine, Friday morning (15Jan2021) and it was outstanding, talk about being organized it was superb. The patient had Pfizer Vaccine Friday morning, and today (17Jan2021) where the shot was, it kind of hurts. And the patient reading the paper that they gave the patient and had redness, it's red and it says you might have side effects, but those are the only side effects the patient had. This hurts a little bit sometimes and it was red. The patient was over weight. Lab data included Height: around 5'2. Outcome of the event hurts a little bit sometimes and it was red was recovering. Outcome of other events was unknown. Information on Lot/batch number has been requested.
84 2021-02-01 joint pain really sick; In bed 2 days; Could not eat; Hurting all over and joints aching; Hurting all over and ... Read more
Close
really sick; In bed 2 days; Could not eat; Hurting all over and joints aching; Hurting all over and joints aching; Fever and really cold; Fever and really cold; Left arm was sore after injection; Left arm was sore after injection and she had a lump and was itching; Left arm sore after injection with lump and itching; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse reported for mother. An 84-year-old female patient received the 1st dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL3249) via intramuscular at arm left on 13Jan2021 13:00 at single dose for prevention because of age group. Medical history included hypothyroid diagnosed many years ago, having Covid in Jun2020. Concomitant medications were unknown. The patient was really sick from an unspecified date. The reporter was starting to wonder if the patient should take the second dose. The patient was in bed for 2 days, could not eat and was hurting all over at 23: 00 on 13Jan2021. Her joints were aching at 23: 00 on 13Jan2021. She had a fever and not really chills, but she just never could get warm and was really cold at 23: 00 on 13Jan2021. She went to bed and woke up on that same date, 13Jan2021, and it started at 11pm. She guessed it was disabling. As it went on, it got better. By Friday, she was finally able to eat. She has plenty of weight to fall back on for not eating. By Friday, she started eating again. She was still not back to normal yet though. She just felt like she could not get up. The fever only went on for a few days. Left arm was sore after injection and she had a lump and was itching 13Jan2021. It worried her. The lump was still itching and sore, but was getting better. Reporter stated that the shingles vaccine did the exact same thing to her with the lump under her skin and itching. It was given on her hip because she had small arm and they were scared to give it in her arm. The reporter wanted to know if there were elderly people in the trial and did any of them have COVID. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the pfizer suspect. Seriousness for In bed 2 days was reported as disabling. Seriousness for Could not eat, Fever and really cold was reported as not serious. Seriousness for Left arm sore after injection with lump and itching was reported as medically significant. Outcome of the events Fever and really cold, really sick was unknown, of other events was recovering.; Sender's Comments: Based on available information, a possible contributory role of the subject product, BNT162B2 vaccine, cannot be excluded for the reported events due to temporal relationship. There is limited information provided in this report. Additional information is needed to better assess the case, including complete medical history, diagnostics, counteractive treatment measures and concomitant medications. This case will be reassessed once additional information is available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

left arm was blue from her shoulder to her elbow almost whole circumference going under arm /left arm discoloration is what she calls "puce", clarifying hers is a purple, black, and blue color; slight left arm swelling; left arm discomfort; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). An 84-year-old female patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot number: EK9231, expiration date: Apr2021), via an unspecified route of administration in the left deltoid on 12Jan2021 14:45 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. On Jan2021, her left arm was blue from her shoulder to her elbow and almost the whole circumference going under her arm. On Jan2021, she has a slight left arm swelling and left arm discomfort. The discomfort was bearable. The discoloration of her left arm has become bad. She was at the COVID-19 vaccine clinic, some nurses looked at her arm, and insisted she contact Pfizer and her doctor to report what happened to her arm. She has an appointment with her doctor the afternoon of 20Jan2021. Her second COVID-19 vaccine dose is scheduled on 02Feb2021. Her left arm swelling and discomfort is the same now, but her left arm discoloration is awful. Her left arm discoloration is the only change she has experienced since her first report. Her left arm discoloration is what she calls "puce", clarifying hers is a purple, black, and blue color. The discoloration of her left arm is uncanny. The discoloration stops before her left elbow like a completely straight line drawn by a ruler. The discoloration continues from her left elbow up to her left shoulder for which the discoloration spreads out unevenly. Outcome of the events was not recovered.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory role of the suspect products cannot be excluded for the reported events based on the known safety profile and temporal association The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators as appropriate.

Patient was brought in by ambulance on 01/28/2021 with complaints of fever, chills, myalgias, shakiness, and severe hypotension. Patient was treated for severe sepsis and acute kidney injury. Patient was given fluid resuscitation, but unresponsive to treatment; NE+ vasopressin, hydrocortisone IV, along with empiric antibiotic regimen were initiated. Patient later on developed pulmonary edema, Non-ST elevation MI with no chest pain and new onset of cardiomyopathy with EF 40-45% and clean coronary arteries shown on cardiac catheterization. Physician suspected cytokine release syndrome related to the COVID vaccine and congestive heart failure. Naranjo scale score of 2 indicates possible ADR. MD indicated vaccine reaction unlikely.
